title: Who plays Edward in Hollyoaks and where have you seen him before?
text:
Edward Hutchinson’s arrival could spell trouble for Tony (Picture: Lime Pictures)

Hollyoaks’ Tony Hutchinson (Nick Pickard) is about to have his life shaken up once more – this time by the arrival on the scene of his dad Edward.

And if that sounds like good news for Tony, then you’d be mistaken – because while the surgeon might claim to have arrived in Chester to reconnect with his family, he’s got a more sinister side which will inevitably show itself before too long.

The character is also tipped to be a major part of the soap’s 25th anniversary celebrations next year – but just who plays Edward, and where have you seen him before?

We’ve got all the information you need.

Who plays Tony Hutchinson’s dad Edward in Hollyoaks?

Edward Hutchinson is played in Hollyoaks by actor Joe McGann.

He’s said of his arrival in the show: I’m coming in to play Edward Hutchinson, a surgeon who is going to rustle some feathers around here. I’m looking forward to that.

He’ll play his part in the soap’s quarter century storylines (Picture: Lime Pictures)

‘I’m looking forward very much to joining in with this very good team, the current Soap Champions!

’25 years of Tony in Hollyoaks and finally we found out where his dad’s come from.’

He added: ‘It’s a blessing to be asked to do this, stepping into such a good team with such good characters.’

Where have you seen Joe McGann before?

How will his son Tony react to his appearance? (Picture: Lime Pictures)

The 61-year-old comes from an acting dynasty which also includes his younger brothers Paul (who played the Doctor in the 1996 Doctor Who TV movie), Stephen (who plays Dr Patrick Turner in Call The Midwife and also starred as Sean Reynolds in Emmerdale) and Mark (who found fame playing John Lennon on the West End stage in the early 80s, and appeared in Russell T Davies’ TV series The Grand).

Joe originally found fame in the comedy series The Upper Hand (the UK version of US hit Who’s The Boss?) which ran from 1990-1996.

His other TV appearances include All Creatures Great And Small, Dangerfield, Prince Caspian and Truckers – while he’s also worked extensively on stage, most recently in the West End production of Elf: The Musical.

As well as acting, he’s also worked as a TV presenter, appearing on STV’s teatime show The Hour alongside Michelle McManus.

Nick Pickard as said of him joining the show: ‘Yesterday, I had the pleasure of meeting Joe McGann who is coming in to play Tony’s dad, Edward.

‘In 2020 we celebrate our 25th anniversary, so what better way than by getting to know some more of Tony’s family? I have to warn you though, Edward is definitely here to ruffle a few feathers! Here’s to the next twenty-five years!’
